pullrequest.title: GPU Lidar: Use the sensor's name as the frame_id

content.raw: Yes, I understand this is the case, but for one, all the other sensors are currently setup to do `<model name>/<link name>/<sensor name>` as their frame id. Another issue with the using `<model name>/<link name>` as the frame id is that it doesn't take into account the pose under the `<sensor>` tag. I believe we had to do it that way in the past because we were using URDF in gazebo9 subT. If we need to keep the frame ids the same between gazebo9-subT and ign-subT, we can create static transforms for `<model name>/<gazebo9 link name>` to `<model name>/<link name>/<sensor name>`  .  I believe each sensor was on its own link so the `<gazebo9 link name>` should be unique.
